Да я купил эту игру и на основной аккаунт.
Сюжет здесь достаточно длительный (около 20 часов, только сюжетных квестов). Основным плюсом сюжета является возможность изменить его ход и получить совсем другие диалоги, задания. То есть сюжет, местами, зависит от ваших действий и предпочтений. Так же концовка игры тоже зависит от ваших решений, выполняли ли вы сторонние квесты или просто проходили сюжет, как вы вели себя с друзьями и девушками т. д.
Боевая система и вообще система прокачек здесь типична для РПГ, находим снаряжение или крафтим его, получаем уровни и вкачиваем их в умения и способности.
Для меня эта игра очень много значит, все персонажи для меня стали родными, и я наизусть помню практически все диалоги и действия персонажей. Я перепрохожу игру почти каждый год и каждое прохождение - примерно 150 часов вместе с дополнениями, игра, безусловно, стоит потраченного времени, и я буду вспоминать и перепроходить её в далёком будущем.
Желаю всем приятной игры.

Simultaneously the best single-player RPG story I've experienced to date and most infuriating movement controls and mechanics.  A wonderful "Winds howling."/10.

- "Run Roach!" *Gets stuck on literally nothing while passing through an archway or over a small bridge.*
- *Swims in awkward circles trying to get the loot option to pop up at the bottom of a lake or bay.*
- *Gets stuck on something while trying to swim out of a cave, sunken ship, or underwater ruin with 30% breath left.*
- *Ignites candles, chandeliers, & lanterns while trying to loot a crate or chest.*
- *While fighting multiple enemies at once.* "Damnit Geralt, quit targeting that one!"
- *While attempting to run from an enemy because you're so fed up fighting it while passing through that area.* "QUIT TURNING AROUND!"
- *Whistles to call Roach.* *Meanwhile in a non-parallel universe Roach spawns a mile away and gets stuck on every fence, tree, bush, and BLADE OF GRASS on his way over.*
- *Fight starts and Geralt decides to use his fists.*  "Geralt, draw your sword.  Geralt, draw your sword please?  Geralt, draw your @!#$!%& sword!"
- *Geralt trips while going down stairs.*
- *Geralt decides it's time to ski back down an incline.*
- *After a cutscene Geralt's decoctions disappear, is thrown into a fight, and those same decoctions haven't been replenished.*

In all seriousness, this game was quite the adventure.  I got the worst ending not just once, but twice because at the time there were no in-depth guides on how to get the best ending.  I also failed several side quests I wasn't aware needed to be completed before progressing the main story or that were dependent upon certain outcomes.  In each of those playthroughs I had at least 100%'d White Orchard and Skellige or Velen/Novigrad as well.  It hurt - was demoralizing even.  After a few years of putting it off I'd finally built up the willpower to complete the perfect playthrough - the best Witcher 2 simulation, the best endings to all quests and story lines, all quests completed (none failed), and 100%'d every area (White Orchard, Velen/Novigrad, Skellige, & Toussaint).  I've done it.  It is finished and I can finally head into New Game+ knowing that I at least did everything right or to my liking at least once.

A few things I would have changed about this perfect playthrough:
- Set the difficulty to Death March before starting and kept it there for the achievement. (My perfect playthrough being my 3rd or 4th time, I didn't want to deal with the struggle.  In hindsight, I think I could have handled it.)
- Disabled enemy upscaling. (This is because there were level 1 rats during a quest which would instakill Geralt due to a problem in the enemy upscaling option.  You can also tell when some enemies fail to get upscaled, some don't, and others receive a buff.  Disabling this option would have also made Death March easier.)

Folks have plenty of gripes with the game and it does need a few quality of life changes but we'll probably never see another update as they're working on a new Witcher game that doesn't feature Geralt as the main protagonist.  I personally was annoyed by some of the bugs I encountered in Toussaint.  It shows that they either pushed the expansion out before it was ready or the development skills of members who might've helped with Cyberbug 2077 started showing:
- White horses spawning in the middle of the street stuck inside each other or blocking doorways into shops.
- NPCs' limbs and clothes going invisible.
- After leaving the merchant near the Nilfgardian embassy the world disintegrated.  Walls, doors, many things went invisible and couldn't be interacted with.  I could see under the map and had to load an old save just to resolve the issue.

Regardless, this is definitely a game - no, a world and a life - worth experiencing.

Tips for new players:
- Take your time.  Take in the sights, smell the flowers, savor the conversations, relationships, and story.  No reason to feel rushed or push until after your first playthrough.
- Save your game often and as a new save!  Quicksave is F5 on the keyboard otherwise you'll need to enter the menu and manually save if using a controller.  You'll never know when something bad will happen (death, outcomes, etc.) and will need/want to reload to try again.
- Play Gwent at every opportunity.  Win cards from opponents and diffuse bad situations while you still can.
- Take all posts from notice boards.  They consist of contracts, side quests, and points of interest.
- Do side quests, contracts, treasure hunts, and explore points of interest before progressing the story.
- Purchase maps from vendors if available - especially in Skellige - to reveal fast travel signs.
- Read your Bestiary for tips on what oils, signs, and potions to use against monsters.
- Loot monsters.
- Loot destroyed monster nests.
- Loot everything out of a guards sight.
- Sell common, magic, and master-crafted weapons and armor you don't need.  Keep relics.
- Dismantle junk for materials or sell it.
- Craft oils, potions, and decoctions as you can.
- Only craft Witcher gear (Cat, Griffin, Wolf, Viper, Manticore, &/or Bear).  There are very few relics that end up actually being better than these sets.  I personally went with Cat (light, bleeds, faster attacks) and upgraded it to Grandmaster.  You can get all the diagrams for every set however it's more efficient to choose and stick with one.
- After killing a monster that grants a trophy, ensure Roach still has the trophy you want equipped.

而妹妹则结合具体国情新出台了紧缩性财政政策缓解通货膨胀，吸纳了大量社会流动资金，取得了卓越成效。“越来越紧了呢，又促进经济稳定持续增长了呢 .收获了生活水平不断提高的哥哥的-致好评。

为人民服务的工作态度.妹妹依旧沉浸在爱岗敬业的无限快乐中，“以后.一定要.对人民负.责...哦，不然..我可要..建立信息公开制度..与办事公开...制度了哟。”

明明那么享受中国梦... 舆论还不老实,看我不加快转变经济发展方式好好思想教育一下这不听话的妹妹:于是哥哥直起身来实施创新驱动发展战略，增强创新发展新动力，深化改革，加快转变经济发展方式的主攻方向，促进资本在全球范围内的流动;牢牢扭住经理建设为中心，聚精会神搞建设，一心一意谋发展，推动了城乡发展一体化。

妹妹日益增长的物质文化需求终于无法忍受:“啊.. ...要全面建成...小康社会了.实现.. 共产义.了...好幸福_..

..全部投入市场了呢，这下糟糕了。“妹妹-脸幸福地说。“还没完呢!“哥哥再次蓬勃发展的经济水平又-次的抬起了头。。啊?!啊__..

I think after 30 something hours of playing the game I am ready to write down a review. I will try to keep it as concise as possible. 
Story: 
You follow the path of the Witcher and his many adventures. Yes, there is the main quest, but there is also tons of side quests, I am almost finished with the second book "Sword of Destiny" and I feel that the game is capturing the soul and the feel of the books very well. It does feel like playing the Witcher with all the monster contracts, the wretches you meet along the way and the odd turns that you face. It never ceases to be interesting, the world is huge and from what I have seen so far, the story is faithful to the overall lore of the Witcher universe. 
Even if you didn't read the books the story will absorb you nevertheless. 

Graphics:
6 years later and it still looks very beautiful, thankfully, this game depends not only on technical beauty but also artistic beauty which is timeless. It runs very smooth on my GTX 1080Ti @4k with almost everything maxed except for hairworks. 

Sound:
The voice acting is superbly done, probably the best I have ever seen in any game. [spoiler]I was mesmerized specially at the part where the old woman is possessed by the three sisters and they speak through her. [/spoiler]. 
Musical score is also some of the best I heard, it switches between ambient exploration music and in fights it becomes intense folklore music, the vocal parts are amazingly done as well. It also changes to fit the story and the mood. 

Gameplay:
No game is perfect, and I feel that The Witcher 3 falls a bit short on gameplay. The fights, while fun, they are simple, or rather simpler than Witcher 2 and Witcher 1. That is not my issue though, my real issue is with alchemy, it had been dumbed down so much to the point that it became generic. To create a potion, all you have to do is collect the ingredients only once and then your potions and bombs will regenerate every time you meditate through consuming Alcohest which is very simple. 
This greatly kills the immersion for me. Part of the fun in Witcher 1 and 2 was when I meditate before a major hunt and I prepare and drink my potions during the meditation phase. It felt real and it felt like what would a Witcher do before a fight. I know this was an attempt from CDPR to make the game more mainstream but I can live with that. 
As for Gwent, I haven't enjoyed a minigame like this since triple triad on Final Fantasy 8 and 9. It is extremely well done and very very fun and interesting to play. I won't spoil it for you but if you enjoyed triple triad, you will love Gwent. 

Closing words:
It is hard to believe that this game came from the same company that created CB2077, the attention to detail is insane and all the quests feel like they have been handcrafted without exceptions. 
For maximum enjoyment, I highly recommend that you at least play the first two witcher games, you can get them both for pennies.

Kilka lat temu, kiedy byłem młodszy, nie miałem dobrego zdania do Wiedźmina. Większość ludzi ciągle mówiło, że ta gra jest taka zajebista i jest najlepszą grą roku. Nie lubiłem grać wtedy w popularne gry. Jakoś w 2016 albo w 2017 miałem pożyczonego Wiedźmina 3 i na początku nie chciałem w niego grać, ale po dłuższej chwili jednak się skusiłem aby w niego pograć. Niestety, ale musiałem po tygodniu oddać grę i przeszedłem tylko pierwszy etap gry i Velen z tego co pamiętam zrobiłem kilka zadań fabularnych. Moja główna historia z Wiedźminem rozpoczęła się 1 stycznia 2021 roku. Kolega miał drugą część tej gry pożyczył mi płytę. Chwilę pograłem i zaczynał mi się coraz bardziej podobać. Poszukałem na Steam ile kosztuje trzecia część tej serii i na szczęście była przecena na 30 zł do 5 stycznia. Poszedłem do sklepu, kupiłem PSC, kupiłem tą grę i rozpoczełem ją na nawyższym poziomie trudności. Nie żałuje tego zakupu, gdyż gra jest bardzo wciągająca, ma ciekawą fabułę, poziom trudności gry jest dobrze zaprogramowany. Dla tych co lubią gry kategorii RPG i nigdy nie grali w ową grę, zapraszam do kupna.
В общем и целом не плохо
Absolutely mint game, in my top 3 easy

An ambitious, atmospheric, story-rich and deeply involving RPG that actually delivers.

The main story itself is incredibly engaging, but it's hard to not get sucked into all the complex sidequests along the way. There were a few moments where I felt like the game was leaning into tired fantasy tropes that I wasn't really a fan of, but I was ultimately either proven wrong, or there were other aspects or story beats that more than balanced out those for me.

On top of that, I also found Witcher 3 to be reasonably accessible to new players, or even ones who were just here to play the easy Adventure Mode. The world's deep lore and complex backstory could seem daunting, but instead I found myself intrigued to learn more with every dialogue Geralt was having, and find out more about our character along the way.

I did experience some lags in my cutscenes and even gameplay (chiefly during storms), but that was most likely the result of some of my PC properties being below the adviced requirements, and even with that, the game remained extremely enjoyable. I also managed to get myself stuck 2 or 3 times, and experienced a bug in the final act where a cutscene wasn't triggered, but I wasn't bothered much thanks to the satisfactory autosave functions.

Overall, this game has something for everyone, even a fun minigame in Gwynt, that I can't stop playing now.

巫师3推平，要说从我去年十一月开始从巫师1推，这1到3也算是正经玩了几百小时了。现在巫师3是本篇+石之心+血与酒的所有主线支线，所有猎魔寻宝和地图上的所有问号全都清理完毕了。但是就这么做完最后一个任务，然后给衣柜上挂几件衣服就算是完结的话，这个收尾也太不够看了。所以还是写篇吐槽。

从打开百果园地图的一瞬间起，你就能看出来巫师3比1和2的内容多了不少。地图也大了不少，甚至要让杰洛特骑着萝卜，而不是拔出剑选群击跑来跑去。这萝卜，说是杰洛特所有马都叫这个名。到了血与酒，就成了就那么一匹萝卜陪着杰洛特浪迹天涯，其主要任务是防止跌落伤害，和在矮墙面前跑不过去。既然提到了跌落伤害，实打实的说，完全就是个给玩家添堵的茬子。巫师1就不允许跳跃，2也完全不能随意实现层级跃迁。但是3就不一样了，看似是更加真实的在一个世界里蹦蹦跳跳，但是要我说2的那套系统更优。

跳跃是万恶之源，鬼知道我多少次跳跃到了设计师没想过的地方。甚至有时候跳到了一些要么根本翻不出去（不是那个著名的水坑），要么得绕着岛游半圈才能上岸的地点。当我每次觉得大家都在说cdpr良心，这个地方搞不赢有个彩蛋，或者什么细节的时候，总能遇到设计师对愿意乱跑的玩家的无限恶意。

巫师系列每一作都需要重新适应，就拿法印来说，1里是通过数字键或者指针调整，到了2就得用Ctrl从左侧选择了，结果来到了3，又改成需要Tab键从上方决定了。法印是个进化的过程。1里法印不过是锦上添花，2里亚克席是你降低战斗压力的好助手，到了3里每种法印多多少少都派的上用场。根据需要见招拆招。

顺便提一句，可能只有我有这个BUG：如果按Tab切换法印并立即施放，会导致游戏彻底卡死。可以使用快捷键和打开菜单，但是所有角色都会一动不动，杰洛特也不会相应任何指令。

有些地方在3里变的好多了，比如敌人血条不同颜色，几乎所有任务清晰到点的指引。如果你和我一样，玩过巫师123的话，会明显感觉到3在任务上的轻而易举。1是线索和提示写满，但是自己也要留意信息，自己加把劲做完。2是生怕你完的成（随便举俩例子：第一章的巨魔头和寻找玛丽娜）。3是生怕你完不成。在1和2里你有些时候一句话说的NPC不对味了，马上拒绝和你交流。3里就几乎没这个问题。

不适应也多少有，首要就是左键和E，1和2里，对话，搜刮，开门，都是左键完成任务。到了3成了E了，左键完全就是平A专用。我至今仍然记得，百果园我第一座旅店的老板娘，在我凌厉地疾风冲击下，扔掉扫帚花容失色惊声尖叫瑟瑟发抖的模样。好在她是个无敌单位。

另一个问题就是跳过。巫师1，2，3是个很长的旅程。太长了，以至于别说到了3，在2的中期甚至是1的部分场景，就和我玩过的大多galgame一样，不会听完每一句语音了。往往是看完字幕，就左键下一句了。这里就是最大的不同了。1和2都是左键下一句。但是1里过场必须通过ESC跳过，而2里变成了双击右键。这就使得剧情体验非常舒适。不打算听完长句的语音？左键马上解决问题。担心不小心跳过了重要的镜头？左键无法跳过任何转场。使得游戏的关键一点都不落下，剧情体验一帆风顺。3就很诡异了，一切跳过都是双空格。这就导致了一个问题，那就是巫师3的台词和过场都很混杂，有长有短，有时候跳过的仅仅是杰洛特坐在椅子旁边。有时候则直接跳过一场精彩的打斗场面，某个人物牺牲的场景。有时候甚至出现重要的转场和最后一句台词黏在一起的情况。原本你只是有一搭没一搭地看一句话不听完整准备下一句，结果两下空格过后直接就是一个加载中，然后就下一个场景了。一想到cdpr在1和2里考虑周全，过场对话两种跳过方式，我就觉得他们是在故意欺负一路玩下来，到了3里略失耐心的我了。

大多数RPG里，到处搜搜刮刮，翻箱倒柜，跑到别人家里搬空是天经地义的，是世界基础的一部分，和拯救世界以及书架上只会有一本半页纸的书一样，是RPG世界无上的潜规则。在1和2里这句话依旧是用。但是到了3就不一样了，街上的箱子和村民家里的粉末一样（为什么你会有这种东西？）。是有主的东西。在大街上，你会被守卫追杀。但是私人住宅的人一点反应都没有，丝毫没有考虑过应该马上指责猎魔人，也从没想过他们应该夺门而出，向村民大声宣告猎魔人的卑劣品行，抑或是打算向当地执法人员告发如此道德败坏的盗窃案件。

这就导致了几个问题。首先守卫是个很诡异的单位。血与酒之中我看到守卫向着预设好的强盗发起攻击。但是群岛里我指控骗子随后发展成一对一的时候，守卫却在旁边叫好。这并不奇怪，从1里你就能看到路人NPC的AI向来不怎么明智。1里你站在大街上，一动不动，路人不会绕过你，而是站你面前几秒之后原路返回。3里成了你站着一动不动，NPC冲到你身上就撞一下碰瓷。

另一个问题就是游戏里的道德审判。不同玩家立场不同，有些人就想在游戏里肆无忌惮一点。有些玩家，比如我，更愿意遵守一些所谓的道德指标，比如我不乐意去攻击有饲主的动物，也不想去盗窃。甚至是试图和NPC对话的时候，E到了道具都想着按Esc退出。（但是我对打捞战利品和海底货物卖出去这种事情没什么心理压力）这一点而言这套系统设计的及其不精明。既然口口声声说玩家可以有诸多选择，那为什么不让有主物品在猎魔视觉里呈现淡蓝色，以更清晰地让玩家遵守自己的原则？陶森特里杰洛特家附近有个孤儿院，为什么这个孤儿院不允许玩家捐款？从出发点来说，你可以说什么物品是有主人的，这样做让时间更真实什么什么的。但是以此延伸出的各种问题，很难有个令人满意的答案。

说到动物，野外往往会有大批雌鹿，山羊，野兔，孔雀等各种小动物。在真实世界里，梅花鹿确实很怕生，哪怕你每天都喂她们，只要你手里没有好吃的。梅花鹿绝对会在你靠近的时候躲开（是的，梅花鹿和梅花鹿体质不同不能一概而论，小部分会允许你靠近摸一摸，小部分）。但是放到游戏里，要是你打算和当地猎人抢口饭吃，这群鹿隔着几十码就能跑的远远的。其他动物，尤其是群岛的山羊，倒是挺好狩猎的。但我更觉得那是因为山羊的AI没写好，毕竟群岛那些山谁爬谁知道。动物往往会掉落丰富的战利品，比如使用伊格尼法印烧死山羊之后，会获得生肉。如果你点选了食物生效20分钟的天赋。1里我随身至少带3瓶的燕子就再也没市场了。而且杰洛特胃力见长呀，1里生肉还有个10毒性。3里直接随时随地磕一块。连前作里有的进食动画都省了。

说到群岛，巫师3也是个遍地问号的主。一部分支线和猎魔也过于相似，尽管不是全部，但很多流程就是受到攻击，询问幸存者，前往事故地点，用猎魔能力追踪，找到巢穴，设置诱饵，打死，带上战利品，然后回去告诉委托人你的XX被杀了，我能做的就是为你报仇，然后拿钱走人，最多你下次偶然路过的时候看看他们又何去何从了——中的一到多个环节组成。就算加上陶森特，也不过是什么强盗营地，秘密宝藏，怪物巢穴，荒废之地，战利品云云。这部分体验因人而异，我周围即使是非常热爱巫师3的朋友也向我坦言，并没有耐心清理问号，尤其是群岛的那些。但是我多少耐得住性子，像是玩孤岛惊魂3那样不远万里，坚持划船，顶着动不动就超重的压力一个个收拾问号。虽然我自认为在清理问号和支线上有那么一点耐心，但这不妨碍这个过程和设计并不完美。必须承认，3的负载系统比2强多了。

说到寻宝，捡到一封信和一把钥匙，然后开锁拿东西是很常见的寻宝任务。如果你有认真读过，或许会对这个世界和里面的各种悲剧感到痛心。哀叹于命运不公，新婚夫妇无法得到幸福，被迫入伍的儿子无法归家，试图证明自己的发明却将自己反噬……你会极其短暂地毫无波澜，转眼间就去关心到底这次能搜到什么好东西。就连你新年举起烟火的时间都比这个长。

巫师系列文本和书籍诸多，但是大多数并无阅读价值。1里倒是不读书的话，打怪也没相应道具掉落。但是说实话，大多数真的只是在浪费时间。水鬼简介：水鬼生活在水边。《如何避开巨型船舰》：你要注意远方的大船。谢谢你的诚恳建议，我坚信这些话语即真实又有效，就如同吸烟有害健康一样。

在巫师3的世界中探索不总是一帆风顺和令人愉快的，群岛的那些山让人困扰，看上去能爬但就是要一路下滑，感觉很不好；有时候稍一不注意就得绕大岛屿游上个几百米。陶森特的地形倒是好了不少，风景优美，星空璀璨，也没那么折腾人。除非你提起另一条BUG，在禁止萝卜奔跑的地形快速移动至户外之后，依旧无法策马狂奔。

忙里偷闲之际，如果你有心情，可以和其他人在马术上一较高下，或者在拳击比赛中取得头筹。巫师3的拳击比赛和1相似，就这点而言我认为2体验更优。在1和2，骰子游戏是最受欢迎的，这游戏纯粹看脸，你的对手就是能一波重掷出个五条，打的你没脾气。但是3里就不一样了，3里有着连不知道巫师3的人都有所耳闻的，大名鼎鼎的昆特牌。巫师3的昆特牌刚刚有个基础和雏形。并没有大多数卡牌游戏的深度策略和精心算计。卡牌本身能力也有限的多，而间谍卡和英雄卡又是不讲道理，朴实无华地强（群岛还有全游戏最强定向检索，虽然除了任务需要我一般打间谍增益北）。导致了有些对局并不靠技巧和经验，仅仅是比哪边强力卡牌更多，谁打出来更多的间谍卡，或者你手头是不是恰好有烧灼或者天气卡。试想一下各位，如果有什么卡组，像是巫师3那样，从左到右按费拍怪，而你的敌人对此没有任何对抗或克制手段，用尽全力也无法在点数上超越你，只能看着你赢下一局又一局。这样的卡组应该如何称呼呢？和谐松鼠！

调度松鼠，陷阱松鼠，和谐松鼠，店店松鼠，跳跳松鼠……松鼠党永不还债。这群你或鼎力支持，或心怀怜悯，或漠不关心，或憎恶有加的群体是1和2的核心。你必须从人类或松鼠党中二选其一。3里的主线和松鼠党几乎半点关系没有。还有你们俩，亚伊文伊欧菲斯！也没在弗妮希尔面前说我两句好话。3里的松鼠党太边缘化了，我一直都觉得1和2里松鼠党和人类的对立冲突非常有看点。结果到了3里没存在感到，准备对抗狂猎之前，我得重新集结部队，都没松鼠党什么事。

在巫师3里，另一经典抉择就是特莉丝和叶奈法之间了。我掷了一枚硬币，是反面。（谁想出来的让特莉丝留下的选项？那地方多危险你不自知的吗？）选择难度因人而异，我倒是觉得决定1里让孩子去夏妮还是特莉丝那里更难择一。

巫师系列的主线就是个追的过程，1里追物件，2里追汉子，3里追妹子。不同的是，希里最终的何去何从依据你的选项有天翻地覆的变化。巫师3贴吧里几乎每天都要有人发帖，凯拉又死了。我的凯拉倒是活得好好的，还给我带来了另一个BUG。但是我的希里就光荣牺牲了。推平本篇之后，回头一看攻略，巫师3的选项简直天坑。“你需要放松，你不用把每一件事都做到完美”和“我应该知道用什么办法让你打起精神”能成为决定结局的核心选项只能用无法理解形容。实际上，决定结局的六个选项全都没有道理可讲：你可以说希里不喜欢杰洛特收皇帝一笔钱，反过来说，找人的时候价钱都谈好了，拿钱办事和错之有？希里自己就接受过猎魔人训练，这些本应心知肚明；让希里独自一人面对女术士或许有助于成长。但是让希里独自面对一群一百来岁（或多少吧）的老油条，菲丽芭但凡使点坏问题可就大发了；让希里炸了实验室释放也许可行，但是实验室里要是还有什么重要情报，甚至联系到希里的健康问题，你把成果炸了缺乏了关键信息怎么办？我可以不客气的对待居民，或者不按他们的传统来。两者之间基本没什么区别。反正我走了他们都可能刨坟。这就导致了一个结果：我丝毫没有对我的选择感到懊悔或者愧疚，也没有对希里的牺牲感到痛苦和自责。反而满脑子想的都是，这编剧脑子不长个六立方米的瘤写不出来这玩意。

我习惯于先清理支线和问号，后收拾主线。这让我多少避开了一些主线的悲剧。也让我既不用杀牛，也不用倒卖珍珠，还不用偷窃，就迅速积累从没让我紧缺过的资金。石之心的投资我眼都不眨一下一瞬间全额买下。血与酒的装修更是让我觉得“就这两下子？”。就连宗师级装备也仅仅让我吐槽一句，我又一次就差点10万经济了！我倒不是装备的收藏党，除了湖女之剑这种有些纪念意义的例外。另外，东西一多之后，打开物品菜单总得卡一下，这个优化应该有一个才对。

说回支线任务，支线任务也有一些耐人寻味。随着你愈发推进，能看到更多真相，有时候事情的发展出人意料。有些任务能让你深入了解一些角色的，比如尤娜这位技艺高超的护甲匠。在一系列任务之后，你才能看到她才是真正值得钦佩的技艺高超之人。在你跑了多个地点，付出了绝对等级的信任之后。尤娜也对你全力帮助，比如允许你打造本篇里的最强护甲，和其他人价格基本一致的原料和修理价格，将你不慎800多卖给她的护甲以3000多的价格回卖给你等。而且游戏没有锁定功能，一个误操作，要么读档，要么花钱买教训吧。

巫师3的读档很慢。我这台电脑有点老旧了，需要短则一两分钟，多则三四分钟来读档。就存读档而言，2里的快速读档才是真的快速读档。无论是对话，选择，小游戏，战斗或者什么，轻轻一下F9马上让你再来一次。但是3的存档也有长处：存档大小比较小。1的存档几十MB，我清理内存的时候发现存档占用了1G多的空间。

总体而言，巫师3是一部内容极多的RPG，比起前作，3既有了些优点，但也多了些前作没有的缺点。彻底推平需要一百多小时，如此庞大的内容使得游戏过程并不是一种煎熬。但是内容愈多，瑕疵和BUG也无法回避。就游戏本身而言，单一的任何一个元素都无法傲视群雄，但是把这些结合在一起之后，出众二字恰好合适。

Super gra, bardzo rozbudowana fabuła na podstawie książki dużo otwartych lokacji oraz znajdziek, a jak się jeszcze do tego wszystkiego doda opcje modowania gry to jest jeszcze lepiej. Jedynymi dwoma minusami na jakie trafiłem w grze to bardzo irytujące bugi związane z jazdą na koniu oraz kres mapy, przez kres mapy mam na myśli problem typu: Patrzę na mapę widzę jakiś budynek albo znak zapytania i chcę do niego iść ale Geralt stwierdza że tam przysłowiowo ,,Diabeł mówi dobranoc" i gra każe mi iść na około albo bugować się tam na siłę np pod wodą albo przez góry. Ale mimo tych dwóch minusów grę każdemu bardzo serdecznie polecam nie tylko ze względu na fenomenalną grafkię czy ambient muzyczny ale także ze względu na ilość rozmaitych zajęć takich jak zbieranie rynsztunków różnych szkół wiedźmińskich, zlecenia czy gra w karty która jest naprawdę dobrze zrobiona. Podsumowując daje grze mocne 9/10

Рекомендую игру к прохождению всей семьёй) Славянский колорит в мифологии и крестьянстве, настоящая речь со всеми матами и оскорблениями, общество, полное стереотипов, любовные романы, пьяные дебоширы, драчуны и Гвинт. Всё это составляет часть игры, но лишь малую, так что там много всего ещё интересного!

- Графика отличная, хотя имеются свои минусы, когда, допустим, на Ведьмаке надет определённый сет брони, но иногда руки Геральта, либо что-то другое, проходит сквозь броню, как будто её и вовсе нет
- Боёвка понятная, интересная, хотя иногда тебя могут просто зажать, что очень неприятно
- О сюжете стоит сказать, что вместе с дополнениями, эта игра - одна из лучших игр мира. Конечно, есть некоторые банальные моменты, но всё же весь сюжет ищется с помощью шерстяной ниточки клубка, который мы постепенно разматываем
- В игре всё зависит от Ваших диалогов и действий. Если вы будете более спокойным и мирным, то некоторые квесты Вы сможете пройти мирно. От диалогов также зависит сюжет. Существует достаточно большая вариация развития событий в разных этапах прохождения сюжета Ведьмака.
- Игры полна дополнительных квестов. Второстепенные квесты здесь - это не просто "сходи и убей", хотя такие квесты тоже есть, они также очень интересны, их ни за что нельзя упускать при прохождении.
- Полностью открытый мир. Захотел - отправляйся куда угодно. Другое дело, что в другой локации монстры могут убивать тебя с одного-двух ударов. Но Вы можете путешествовать по миру, исследуя маленькие деревушки и пещеры, можете почти в любой момент прохождения сюжета перейти к прохождению второстепенных квестов. Пока гуляете по миру, Вы точно встретите десяток квестов, которых не было на карте, ибо они появляются случайно, когда Вы гуляете. Просто путешествуя, можно получить резко какой-нибудь квест, что добавляет для Мира Ведьмака ощущение того, что мир в игре живой
- В игре специфическая система поиска снаряжения. Когда убиваешь врага, с него может упасть какая-то броня или оружие, но потом ты можешь где-то ещё найти точно такую же вещицу, у которой характеристики лучше или хуже. В игре существуют одни и те же типы оружий, но в зависимости от Вашего уровня, орежие будет сильнее или слабее
- Также насчёт брони и оружия: существует система прокачивания и первого, и второго. С помощью дополнения "Каменные сердца" можно улучшать всё это дело ещё более интересным способом
- В игре существует система прокачивания персонажа с помощью мутаций, а в дополнении "Кровь и Вино" эти мутации могут продвинуться ещё дальше
- Игра затягивает. Я наиграл 92ч, учитывая то, что я не прошёл дополнение "Кровь и Вино" и на четверть, что я не выполнил кучу доп. квестов и не исследовал мир. Игра сможет приносить удовольствие не протяжении многих часов

Как мне кажется, всё же я многое упустил, но постарался всё изложить конструктивно и объективно.
Игру к прохождению рекомендую!
Начало годное. Голый ведьмак моется в корыте, всем советую.

一部关于猎魔人：利维亚的杰洛特[strike] 打桩机[/strike]的传奇故事。巫师3剧情有大量丰富的对话，帮你拓展和了解巫师世界架构和背景信息（还有书籍、路人npc聊天、宣传单等等）。任务系统里主线/支线任务具有多元化完成方式，其中关键任务中不同选择将产生不同的结局[spoiler]（结果可以影响诸如国家战争、人物生死、人物好感度、以及关键角色最终结局等等） [/spoiler]。个人认为支线任务剧情更为丰富并更具有探索性，适合喜欢探索和讲故事的玩家。战斗系统中个人未深度体验不同流派的打法，翻滚流体验中规中矩。地图系统由于路线指引的原因，一些目标地点需自行探索，却增加了游戏探索度和乐趣[strike]洞穴中的路痴玩家头发-1，桌子HP-1 [/strike]。总的来说，巫师3本身是一款入手绝不后悔的好游戏，即使上述的这些你都不在意，不是还能来一局紧张刺激的昆特牌吗？

Probably the most amount of time time I've spent in a single player RPG. Combined with the GoG version, I have over 300 (specifically 215 hours on Steam, and 100 on GoG) hours spent in the game. I would 100% recommend this game to any person; the amount of detail put in this game shows how much time and passion the developers put into it. This can be seen from the world's detailed characters, the story, the subtle differences in the story dependent on the choices you make, and the detailed side quests. 5 years later, closing in on 6, I believe other developers working on open-world RPGs should strive to add the kind of detail like the Wild Hunt had (because honestly, I'm fed up with open-world games).

The only major complaint I had is with some morally ambiguous side quests, which significantly limit the player's choice, especially when considering a Witcher's arsenal. That being said, once again I'd like to emphasize, I would ABSOLUTELY recommend this game to anyone interested in a single player RPG.

The Witcher 3 does not respect my time. 7.8/10 dont recommend if you have literately anything else that requires major commitment...like a job and family if you want to get through this game in less than a couple months

As an Rpg in some aspects it is impressive but lacking in any meaningfulness decent with some purpose or lacking in understanding of how to address problems that have plagued RPGS (and would need to tackle to deserve the praise it does IMO) This game may have lots of content but that doesn't matter when you feel like you are going nowhere in terms of progression and overall feels like more spectacle than substance.

Let me start off my criticism with the most....i want to say....immediately pressing and would be instantly brushed off as a illegitimate criticism: the open world. Open worlds have come a long way but they have had problems that have been addressed and similar to criticisms of certain games that have hub worlds, yes you might have side quests and little caves that might have a enemy or 5 and a chest or 2, but side-quests are guided by level and have a level system in an open world game isn't inherently bad but when you give me shit from the DLC and like level 37 quests i can find at level 7 (IF I EXPLORE WHICH IS LIKE THE ENTIRE PURPOSE OF AN OPEN WORLD) it would have been better to split up places and have a more streamlined experience and not risk me finding end game stuff at levels where that shit dont and wont matter until i have invested 100+ hours (and has been solved in other rpgs (and solved in a really popular one that has re-released more times than my niece has lived in years *hint**hint) btw)) in and with how shallow the main way of progression is *cough**cough* bad combat system *cough**cough* (aside from the stories told cause in terms of that the main quests  stories they tell are decent and only really never drop lower than mundane with slight intrigue which is something that 99 percent of other games especially in this genre NEVER come close to which is saddening as rpgs are up there for me along with action and platforming in terms of how much I like them)) with the depth-less fluff that is most of the side-side-content like the caves and little areas and things to that extent that are as shallow of content i have seen in many RPGS but praised here as "not necessary stuff they just happened to put in for US, yes worship company" and here is one of the major problems further facilitated by "side content" in rpgs *ahem* SIDE CONTENT IS NOT SIDE CONTENT IF YOU NEED TO DO IT TO PROGRESS TO A POINT THAT YOU CAN DO MORE "INTERESTING" *cough**cough* bad combat system *cough**cough* (in this one) SHIT, WHICH 1. RPGS FROM THE 1990s TO NOW HAVE SUFFERED FROM and 2. A GAME WOULD NEED TO ADDRESS TO BE CONSIDERED THE BEST GAME/RPG OF ALL TIME BECAUSE BELIEVE IT OR NOT IT WOULDN'T BE A PROBLEM IF HOW YOU PROGRESS WASN'T SO SCATTER-BRAINED and  is resolved with better consideration of the risk and problems of having an open world & a leveling system that has been done better in games where there 1. weren't any open worlds and 2 had the devs consider progression and added solutions like the level of a quest being determined by your current level, or enough experience to when you experience that section you'd be the right level to progress, etc. To me it seems the open world was put in not to be genuine used fully consistently or of better quality as a game than games without one like in nondescript nintendo paper styled rpg from early 2000s (the last good one on nondescript cube console) & other nondescript open-world fanatsy nintendo rpg from late/mid 2010s on nondescript handled and portable console but more as spectacle that ended up hurting how you progress through it which AGAIN has been solved for YEARS and further contributes to me not seeing eye to eye on people that over-indulge in the fantasy that is this game being better than like a 7.8/10 from a company that was praised until recently, that has put up a good face of pro-consumerism in the eyes of the gaming landscape (& seems to me why some think its better than it is)

DO YOU WANT TO TALK ABOUT THE FUCKED COMBAT SYSTEM THAT IS SO MEDIOCRE AND FLAWED THAT IT FORCES ME TO THINK THAT PEOPLE THINK THIS GAME IS 10/10 ARE 100% BUTT-FUCK FUCKING INSANE. First of let me list the problems then go more in depth with them: lack of complexity, stuttery fucking mess (partly to blame is the movement system), problems with communication and lack of impact due to it.

Complexity: At most the complexity of this combat system is select one ability that is the obvious weakness of the enemy use it and kill it or allow it to be damaged then wait to do again. Nothing really offensive here but expecting this to support a game for more than 8 hours is a fucken pipe dream and the enchanting system only insults this system really and screams the most surface level and actually a slight lack of understanding on how to make a combat system fun.

stuttery fucking limiting mess: This game has lock on and movement  system worse than darksouls and darksouls doesnt have to most complex or better than average movement system in terms of mechanical skill needed (Dark Souls however uses the parameters that it does have masterfully though) and due to this lack complexity you'd think it be good just fundamentally and this is were i must express this idea: 1.movement is the most important thing to nail even in an RPG (it doesnt have to be complex btw it just has to be good enough for the feel you want & used in a way where you understand its limits & use what you do have masterfully (ie. DarkSouls...again)) and 2. Animation based movement (rather than just pure parameter/programmed with animation made to match up or not depending on how lazy you are feeling when programming/animating-based movement that doesn't take into account some mundane parts if the world like a small ditch in a dirt road for example (unless you let physics take over small details but even then if the ditch is deep enough it wont look realistic) Isnt always the answer and actually is less responsive if implemented poorly like it is here. It is done really well in things like Shadow of War (where lots of predictions are used and could have aspects of real-time animation used but still seems to be animation based (CORRECT ME IF I AM WRONG HERE)) and an example of good control without pure animation based movement A Hat In Time (the best platformers have gotten in terms of base mechanics though it could still be improved and slight side tangent: (UNDERSTAND THE IMPORTANCE OF USING THE CAMERA'S FORWARD VECTOR instead of the CHARACTER'S in certain circumstances AND IT'll MAKE YOUR GAME BETTER... if you know how to use it right when making a platformer or any game for that matter it'd be better... fuck realism and/or oversights in impact of a small detail as such and improve game feel) Anyway back on topic, Wicther 3's movement when walking around relatively flat or spacious and kinda round terrain seems fine then add trees and attack tracking & the same 1 or 2 animations when attacking and the problem is exacerbated if not semi-consistent in its effect; getting stuck on terrain and being zoomed up if in jutting and spike like terrain happens and thus the realism achieved in the walking cycle MEANS EVEN LESS THAN THE NOTHING IT SHOULD.

"problems with communication and lack of impact due to it": now you might think"communication what the fuck is this talking about?" but show the general point animation and effects are used to what? To show you and communicate to you what the fuck is happening. Witcher has this problem when doing heavy attacks/bad use particle effects when attacking in general & thus the problem of lack impact occurs due to it. and to i realized that i reached the word count when trying to add more at some point but i have many more problems here than stated here i could go into quests and the good of it. :D

当初看玩这游戏打到男爵线

初次见面以及接触的一段时间我觉得男爵无非是个昏庸的小领主，口出妄语，我想着一言不合我就准备把这里全屠一遍搜刮啤酒的。可当男爵因自己喝醉家暴妻子导致流产，将女儿尸体埋在后花园时我没生气。因为一句话“她太了解我了，她懂得如何伤害我”

当她需要流产死去的女儿化为家事精灵帮他找回他的出轨妻子时，杰洛特对男爵说你最好帮她（女儿）取个名字。男爵在去后花园找女儿的过程中抱怨了多次想不出名字。而当他看见已化为尸婴，面目狰狞，全身是血的女儿时，他先是露出厌恶，随后在杰洛特的要求下，以及对出轨妻子的思念，冒着被咬破喉管的风险抱起了女儿。

男爵的暴躁在意识到这个小怪物确实是自己女儿时消失不见，此刻他只感无限悲凉

男爵在家门前跟着杰洛特颤抖地念出咒语

“以天空与大地的力量”
“以原本会成为你家园的世界”
“那来到我身边，我却没有接纳的孩子，请原谅我”
“汝之名蒂亚！”

“我接纳你为我的女儿。”

男爵完全没有停顿，流畅的说出了名字，仿佛尸婴还活着，而这就是她原本的名字。暴雨如同天哭一般，雨点不要命地打在这位血腥男爵身上，他几乎分不清脸上的是泪水还是雨水。

此刻这位身披板甲征战多年的战士第一次感到如此的无力

这一刻没有血腥男爵，只有一位忏悔的中年父亲

Pros:
 - A rich and complete RPG experience with a wide variety of high quality quests.
- An ambitious scope that was very expertly executed, and nearly incomparable to anything else made so far. 
- The quest quality is pretty consistent throughout the game, even over a hundred hours in, you'd think the game wouldn't be able to keep up with the level of detail that it offers in the first hours, yet it does exactly that and then some.
- Great story and writing, from the main quest to the smaller quests and the stories and characters that you'll encounter, lots of detail and love were poured all over this world, some of which you might not even encounter on your first playthrough. Any and all sorts of emotions and moments that you'll probably remember for years to come.
- Decisions you make have a pretty substantial impact in the story and on other characters, making you feel the weight of responsibility, some of the choices are surprisingly difficult to make.
- Substantially different endings based on your choices.
- The game doesn't pull many punches when it comes to the number romantic options that it offers, some will even influence certain aspects of the story, it's romantic when it needs to be, it's sexy when it needs to be, and at times pretty funny.
- Gameplay has taken what was made in the earlier installments, build upon it and create a very polished and intuitive improvement, the combat feels amazing and personal, with you being able to find your own play style and groove. It plays like a smooth action-adventure game despite being a massive and comprehensive RPG.
- A character upgrade system that will allow you to improve Geralt's fighting, signs (which are basically spells) and alchemy which influences your effectiveness with potions and bombs. Offering more in the way of play-style customization.
- Tons of different weapons and gear that you can use, as-well to different effects that you can add.
- The visuals are great, with an amazing art direction, I have no doubt that this game will age pretty well.
- The world is beautiful to look at, from the different cities, to small villages, islands, mountains and forests, this game has some of the most realistic forests and green environments that I've seen in game, there's a really nice chaotic feel of how trees and plants are placed which makes it feel very natural. The weather system directly impacts how everything looks and the world and even NPCs react to it accordingly. One of the best day/night cycles that I've seen in a open world, dusk and sun rise can at times look absolutely stunning.
- Beautiful music throughout the game.
- Great DLCs that add tens of hours of content, none of it feels lazy or by the numbers, instead it feels like genuine contributions to the world, with some of the writing and quests being of higher quality than even most of what we've encountered in the main game, which was already pretty good. Blood and Wine in particular is probably the single best story-based DLC that I've seen in a game. 
- Gwent is an awesome addition to the franchise, and far superior to the prior mini-games.

Cons:

- I've experience multiple crashes, and by multiple, I really mean it. This game crashed a lot. And I know for a fact that this is a game issue and not a system issue, because this level of frequent crashing only happened when played The Witcher 3, in fact, I have yet to experience this problem on their newest Cyberpunk game or on any other game that I'm currently playing. Very unfortunate and by my far my biggest issue with this game and what prevents it from being a 10/10 in my eyes.

- The in-game economy is very unbalanced, I find myself very often finding most of the weapons and gear that I need just by exploring the world, I consistently found swords that were an immediate upgrade to swords that I've just picked not long ago, giving me very little incentive to explore crafting or buy weapons from stores, if anything, I mostly used stores to get gold from selling the excess weapons and gear that I would frequently find in the game world. The exception being when I wanted a particular armor that I would only get through crafting.

- The menus and in-game interface although you'll eventually get used to it, its not the most intuitive.

- The game could have offered more way for me to spend my gold, like buying houses, decoration and properties. The Blood and Wine DLC introduces some of that in the game, thought because you're supposed to play it after the main campaign, it all comes a bit too late. Would be awesome to have had a place to improve and decorate with different items from my different adventures, earlier in the game, maybe even have some of the main characters drop by. Though I do realize this is less of a flaw and more of a personal wish and nitpick.

Overall:

The Witcher 3 is arguably one of the best RPGs ever made, if not the best, if you're a fan of the genre or if you are curious about what a CDPR game looks at its best, I definitely recommend you to skip on Cyberpunk 2077 until they fix it, and instead dive into the world of the Witcher and learn exactly why this studio became so beloved by so many gamers. This is an awesome journey that has pretty much everything a game could offer, an immersive world and story that will keep you interested, lots to do and explore and you'll always feel in control of the pace of which you want to experience the game. If you want to pick up the game to just do some quick Witcher contracts and slash some monsters, you can, if you want to just walk, swim, ride and sail around the massive world and probably always finding something in the process, you can. If you want to just play Gwent and collect new cards from NPCs you can, and if you want to experience one of the best video-game stories and story-based quests ever written and designed, The Witcher 3 will be there for you with very little risk of leaving you disappointed.

Witcher is by me, one of the best games I've played in my entire life. From the very begining I really dive in to this world and really enjoyed playing for several hours a day. From the main storyline to the smallest quest u can really tell that they were made with direct concept. The moral dilemas and choices are in point. The characters are fenomenal. Only some parts of gameplay like clunking moving or some level buildings are  sometimes annoying, but besides this it's a great game.

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt ist der 3. Teil in der großartigen Witcher Serie. Erneut übernimmt man die Rolle des Hexers Geralt, der sich durch eine wunderschöne Welt voll Monster und interessanter Charaktere kämpft um seine Ziehtochter Ciri zu finden und die gefährliche Wilde Jagd aufzuhalten. Dabei benutzt er magische Zeichen, Schwerter und sein unglaubliches Charisma um sich den Gefahren dieser Welt zu stellen. Auch alte Bekannte wie Triss, Rittersporn und Yennefer sind wieder mit von der Partie.

Positives:
- eine riesige Open World mit Tonnen an Orten und Geheimnissen zu erkunden
- wunderschöne, abwechslungsreiche Szenerie mit großartiger Grafik
- anspruchsvolle Boss-Kämpfe
- Tonnen von Nebenmissionen
- großartige Story
- unglaublich viele interessante Charaktere zum kennenlernen
- deine Entscheidungen beeinflussen die Story
- sehr viele verschiedene Enden
- großartige DLCs die die Story und Map nochmal um zig Spielstunden erweitern

Negatives:
- der Fallschaden ist übertrieben hoch. Wenn Geralt vom Sessel runterfällt stirbt er. (Ja gut das ist jetzt übertrieben, aber es bringt es ca auf den Punkt)
- Im Wikingergebiet gibt es zu viele Banditenverstecke (Ihr werdet noch sehen wovon ich spreche)

Zusammenfassung:
The Witcher 3 ist in meinen Augen das beste Spiel, das bisher je produziert wurde. Es macht unglaublich viel Spaß und bietet auch die Möglichkeit einen erneuten Durchlauf zu starten ohne die Story zweimal gleich gespielt zu haben. Man kann stundenlang nur durch die Welt reiten und sich wunderschöne Sonnenuntergänge anschauen. Es ist abwechslungsreich und hält einen durchgehend bei Laune. Das perfekte Spiel für Fantasy Fans die nach eine sehr umfangreichen Spiel suchen. (Ja 159 Stunden war ein Durchlauf plus Dlcs)

Ah, the witcher 3, l'un des jeux qui a eu le plus de promos sur steam au point que je me suis dit, vu les critiques positives, pourquoi pas ? J'avais déjà tenté le deuxième volet, l'introduction m'avait refroidi et le combat beaucoup trop lourdingue à mon goût.

Celui-ci a été retravaillé, mais il reste des aspects qui me laissent perplexe. Avant de les aborder, les points positifs qui se distinguent des autres jeux RPG et qui donnent une identité au jeu :

- L'histoire, bien sûr, je n'ai pas lu les livres dont s'inspire le jeu, il y a sûrement des passages éludés ou d'autres enjolivés, mais je l'ai trouvé cohérente, on a envie de connaître la suite d'un rebondissement imprévu.

- Les lieux visités, on sent que ce n'est pas du copy-paste habituel dans certains jeux en monde ouvert, certes les PNJ en ville ont des clones mais l'ambiance dans les villes est crédible, et pour s'immerger dans un jeu, c'est plaisant.

- Le gameplay, même s'il y a des failles, tranche un peu des autres jeux, chaque monstre ayant ses faiblesses, on peut bien sûr y aller à la mode bourrin et ne rien lire du monstre que l'on combat mais le combat se prolonge de fait deux fois plus longtemps.

Niveau points négatifs, là où le jeu pêche :

- Les moments "creux" de l'histoire, incarner Ciri, les cinématiques à foison pour tout déroulement, d'accord, c'est sympa mais à la longue 3 cinématiques pour une courte phase de gameplay, on sent bien que les développeurs aiment montrer ce qu'ils ont fait plutôt que de laisser le joueur agir à sa guise.

- Les combats en endgame, ce qui m'a fait quitter le jeu et ne pas tenter le mode new game +, armure complète faite, améliorations au max et...plus rien en face qui résiste. Ce qui faisait le sel du combat au début du jeu tourne à la farce, plus besoin d'esquiver, on spamme une attaque tournoyante sur des ennemis chargeant sur vous, regen et buff sur chaque victime et c'est plié.

- Le principe du newgame +, peu de jeux ont ce système, d'ordinaire c'est "tu finis le jeu, youhou, prends ta tablette de chocolat et regarde les crédits défiler, plus qu'à tout recommencer". En soi je suppose que tout est réinitialisé, mais au fond quel intérêt hormis choisir l'inverse de ce que l'on a choisi pendant l'histoire ? Niveau gameplay, ce seront les même ennemis plus forts qui ralentiront la progression à mesure jusqu'à reprendre le cycle "je tue tout ce qui bouge" décrit juste avant.

- Les bugs, alors là difficile de ne pas en avoir au moins un pendant toute une partie et quand on voit ce qui s'est passé avec Cyberpunk, les prémices étaient déjà là...

- La gestion de l'inventaire du personnage, catastrophique, on a bien un coffre mais faire le tri dans les objets que l'on ramasse entre le nécessaire (armes, armure, outils pour réparer armes et armures) et l'accessoire (chaque objet peut être pris sans que l'on sache concrètement s'il peut être recyclé, vendu directement ou complètement inutile) est une corvée. On ne sait plus quoi choisir à récupérer, et j'en suis venu à me dire, je me limite aux armes/armures, ce qui rend l'intérêt des autres objets à foison à récupérer très limité voire inutile.

- Le monde "ouvert", gros point mis en avant qui...n'en est pas un au sens propre, on a plusieurs cartes, plus ou moins grandes, oui, mais pour aller de l'une à l'autre, écran de chargement avec le résumé de l'histoire présente. La première fois, ça paraît sympathique, la 10e fois, ça devient longuet. Si le studio s'est aperçu que beaucoup de joueurs ne terminaient pas l'histoire, c'est justement qu'il y a plethorre de quêtes secondaires, assez soignées mais remettre le fil rouge en avant à chaque fois "coucou, tu t'étais arrêté là au fait", non, je ne suis pas un poisson rouge, merci.

- Le leveling, impossible de grapiller la moindre expérience en tuant des ennemis (hormis les nids de monstres), tout passe par des quêtes, elle-même à des niveaux précis. Le jeu évite l'écueil de farm de niveau, certes, mais c'est aussi une façon détournée de dire "j'ai envie que tu fasses ce que j'ai programmé, et si ça ne te plaît pas, tu resteras à taper avec ton épée en mousse".

Conclusion, un jeu agréable par l'histoire mais qui montre ses failles à tout axer autour de l'histoire et moins sur le gameplay, ce qui pour un jeu "open world" devient problématique. C'est un peu le principe d'un joli gâteau dans une vitrine, on a plaisir à le voir, de savoir comment il a été cuisiné mais au final le goût est un peu fade.

A voir si le prochain TES6 ou un autre hypothétique RPG Open world peut reprendre certaines idées et corriger ses écueils...

[h1] Geralt z Rivie [/h1]

Je to úžasná hra z fantastického světa kouzel a příšer, které máte za úkol kosit, nebo se s nimi domluvit. Zaklínač není jen bezduchý vrah. Má svůj charakter, protože je to Geralt a ne např. Lambert.

Hra má skvělou grafiku i na dnešní dobu, ale hlavní je příběh, která vás ponoří do tohoto světa plného čar a monster. Plno vedlejších úkolů, které si musíte najít. Pokud hrou proletíte za pár dní. tak se taky může stát, že jich plno vynecháte a ujde hráči pěkný úkol zapadající do příběhu.

Dle mého názoru je tato hra povinnost pro každého RPG hráče, nebo prostě pro toho, kdo rád hry s duší, protože to je to, co dělá hru Zaklínač 3 originální.

Even after all these years the game looks astonishing (and the modding community did an amazing job bringing this game to its full graphical potential). 
The story is interesting and addictive, the side quests are meaningful, the characters are likable and you do care about them. I really liked how side quests intertwined with the main story is masterfully done.
And the best of all – it stays true to the book’s lore and atmosphere, which is engrossing. CD project red did an amazing job, and I can not state enough how much I appreciate what the did in this regard.
If by any change you still did not play this game, please do. The best experience gaming has to offer.

Good game, I played too many hours over a short period of time though and tired myself out - I wouldn't recommend travelling and discovering most locations as they are mainly the same with similar enemies. Combat is fun and challenging on the hardest difficulty, I would recommend doing this in addition to turning on level scaling and also increasing the Gwent difficulty. If you dislike combat you can always reduce the difficulty.

我是在DLC捆绑包折扣期间买的这游戏.
我是第一次在Steam中留言.
我必须承认我错了,错的离谱,我第一次见到这个游戏是在Youtube上,一位Youtube实况,但是我仅仅是看了几分钟后就武断决定这个游戏不好玩,直到2021/1/16我看见了巫师三的折扣,我在好奇之下直接购买了这款游戏,连玩了3~5天,游玩时长达到了57.4小时.
游玩了这么久之后,我承认这钱是一定花的值得的.
同时因为2077的关系也导致我来这里留了言.多的不就不说了,我相信懂的人都懂,看看其他人的留言就明白了.

Experiência única pra quem curte RPG, uma obra-prima da CD. Não é a primeira vez que eu jogo, e mesmo assim o jogo conseguiu me imergir como se tivesse descobrindo o jogo. Só é preciso relevar a mecânica do Carpeado, e a movimentação do Geralt quando é preciso dar só um passinho, ou quando precisa achar um item pequeno debaixo d'agua, que as vezes pode ser estressante. Caso jogue com aumento de inimigo ativo, lembre de desligar para enfrentar o Djinn e os ratos que são encontrados nos esgotos de Novigrad. Por increça que parível, eles ficam impossíveis de se derrotar assim.
男爵离开了威伦，再也没有人陪我打牌

Это максимально затягивающая игра, с интересными и прописанными персонажами, с красивыми пейзажами, а также не надоедающей боевой механикой. Последствия собственных решений влияют на концовку, поэтому при прохождении думаешь о своих словах и действиях, а если же концовка не устроит - то можно перепройти игру снова, и снова и снова... Музыкальное сопровождение, а также озвучка на высочайшем уровне. Игра может быть местами мрачной, но при этом не обделяет юмором. Лучшая РПГ за последние несколько лет, мне не жалко времени, которое я в ней провел! :)
This game will never get old after playing for the 2nd time round. What more can i say? Just play. It's quite captivating.

Si vous avez aimé Skyrim, Assassin's Creed et Fable, vous allez assurément aimer ce jeu. Riche en histoire, monde ouvert, loot en abondance, monstres de toutes sortes avec des faiblesses particulières, des styles de combats et de skills différents. Je conseille fortement!
